required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Virtual Reality in Children With Hemiparesis
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Virtual Reality on Selective Motor Control and Upper Limb Functions in Children With Hemiparesis: A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: children with cerebral palsy have impaired selective motor control and upper limb functions that affect their performance

detailed_description.textblock: Twenty volunteer children diagnosed with hemiparetic cerebral palsy will be recruited from national institute of neuromotor system. they will be randomly assigned to intervention and control group.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Control grouprecivedvDesigned occupational therapy programe including Exercises facilitating hand skill patterns will include basic reach, grasp, carry and release and the more complex skills of in-hand manipulation and bilateral hand use. â€¢ study group will recieve Wii virtual reality games Bowling Frisbee Basketball Boxing
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Selective voluntary motor control of upper extremity
primary_outcome.description: Test of Arm Selective Control will be used to assess selective voluntary motor control of upper extremityIt was developed to quantify the extent to which children with cerebral palsy have selective voluntary motor control. It will be used to assess movement of shoulder, elbow, forearm, wrist, finger and thumb by using simple tools for grasp items from two starting sitting positions

secondary_outcome.description: it will be assessed by hand held dynamometer
it will be assessed by Bruinink-Oseretsky test for motor proficiency subset 7 of upper limb coordination

intervention.description: Exercises facilitating hand skill patterns will include basic reach, grasp, carry and release and the more complex skills of in-hand manipulation and bilateral hand use.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- - Age between 7 and 11 years
- spasticity grade of 1+ or 2 on MAS
- level I and II on GMFCS
- level II and III on MACS
- Being able to cooperate and being motivated
Exclusion Criteria:
- visual or auditory problems Severe spasticity (an Ashworth spasticity score of 4 in any upper or lower extremities) Severe mental retardation surgeries for spasticity within the past 12 months, toxin injection within the past six months.
- Structural or fixed soft tissue deformities in the affected upper extremity
